ygData.subject: Re: A weekend in East Karana
ygData.msgSnippet: Noting in Crushbone will attack a Dark Elf.  I have strolled threw there on many an occasion with Jaade.  The Dwarven Bandits and the two Ogres will also NOT
ygData.messageBody:
Noting in Crushbone will attack a Dark Elf. I have strolled threw there on
many an occasion with Jaade. The Dwarven Bandits and the two Ogres will
also NOT attack a Dark Elf. As long as she didn't attacked D'Vinn she will
be fine. D'Vinn conned amiable to me.

Warn your friend that if she continues to kill Crushbone orcs, she will come
home to Neriak one day and have not home - which means no training either.

Maline D'Assault
> "Klotzen, nicht Kleckern"
>
> ----------
> From: Kelly[SMTP:pruett@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, June 08, 1999 7:32 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] A weekend in East Karana
>
> From: Kelly <pruett@...>
>
> Will a mob kill your whole party if it is attacked by just one individual?
>
> Yes and no. I've had an interesting experience while being partied with a
> friend
> who plays a rogue. Most of the group has problems with the tough mobs and
> will
> die if it starts attacking the party .... except for the rogue.
>
> Here's an example. While doing the screaming mace quest we were camped in
> the
> tower of Crushbone waiting for Emperor Crush to arrive. Assured that
> Ambassador
> Dvinn was at the zone killing newbies, we continued to wait without any
> concern.
> Suddenly Crush spawns ... no problem, we begin the whacking. Then, about 3
> or 4
> seconds later, Dvinn spawns. Wham Wham Wham, one down ... etc until 5
> party
> members were dead, none even made it past the throne.
>
> Except for the rogue who sat there plain as day, probably messing herself
> from
> the fear. He never touched her, and in fact conned to her as indifferent I
> believe. She was able to do corpse retrievals for some of us as we all
> waited at
> the zone.
>
> Soooooo, I think as long as the mob is dubious or auto-attack toward
> everyone in
> your group, then yes, he will kill the whole group. I guess it pays to
> take a
> dark elf or rogue along with you at times.
>
> -Rosmorte (aka Faderic)
>
>
>
> Tom Swift wrote:
>
> > From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
> >
> > As a side note. If one of your group is engaged on combat by and
> > mob...named or not....then once your party member is dead the mob will
> come
> > after the next closest party member and so on till all are dead or
> zoned, or
> > you kill the mob.
> >
> > When a giant attacks a party member...first thing I do is DISBAND! Same
> goes
> > for anything that can wipe out the whole party. We disband and then
> regroup
> > when the danger is passed. Then the whole party doesn't have to run to
> zone
> > to regroup which can save considerable time.
> >
> > This can upset some people so it is best to make sure everyone
> understands
> > before it happens. To many people die becuase giants can destroy a
> party
> > before anyone realizes the trouble. 90+ damage per hit makes short
> work of
> > most players especially after being stunned.
> >
>
>
